Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll do a thorough check of your teeth, gums, and mouth to understand your overall oral health and identify any concerns early.
A routine dental check-up to monitor your oral health and catch any issues before they become bigger problems.
A short dental exam focused on a specific issue or tooth that's bothering you.
We’ll sit down with you to discuss your dental concerns and smile goals, and explain the treatment options best suited for you.
A longer consultation for more detailed discussions, perfect for complex treatments or second opinions.
A formal written report about your dental condition, often needed for referrals, insurance, or records.

Item Name: Intraoral Periapical Or Bitewing Radiograph - per exposure
Patient-Friendly Description: A small X-ray to look closely at a specific tooth or area to check for problems like decay or infection.
A full-mouth X-ray that lets us see your entire jaw and all teeth in one image – useful for wisdom teeth, implants, or overall checks.
A quick test of your saliva to assess your risk of tooth decay or gum disease and help us plan your care.
We’ll test the nerve of a tooth to see if it's alive or damaged – helpful for diagnosing pain or trauma.
We’ll take impressions of your teeth to make a model. This helps us plan your treatment and show you what your future smile might look like.
We’ll take close-up photos inside your mouth to track your progress and treatment results.
We’ll take photos of your smile and face to ensure everything stays balanced and looks natural.
We’ll create a mock-up of your expected results so you can preview your new smile before we begin.
We’ll scan your teeth digitally to create a precise 3D model. It’s quick, clean, and helps us plan accurately.
We’ll clean off surface stains and plaque to freshen up your smile and help keep your teeth healthy.
We’ll polish or reshape your current fillings to make them smoother, more comfortable, and look better.
We’ll remove tartar and hard build-up from your teeth to reduce inflammation and improve gum health.
A follow-up cleaning to remove remaining tartar and maintain your gum health.
We’ll gently smooth out surface stains or white spots on your teeth for a more even appearance.
We’ll whiten the inside of a darkened tooth that’s had root canal treatment to match your other teeth.
We’ll safely whiten your teeth to brighten your smile and boost your confidence.
We’ll give you custom-made trays and gel so you can whiten your teeth at home, gradually and comfortably.
We’ll apply fluoride or a similar agent to your teeth to help prevent cavities and strengthen enamel.
We’ll recommend special at-home products to help protect and remineralize your teeth between visits.
We’ll apply a highly concentrated treatment to strengthen your teeth and reduce the risk of cavities.
We’ll apply a highly concentrated treatment to strengthen your teeth and reduce the risk of cavities.
We’ll teach you the best way to brush and floss so you can keep your mouth as healthy as possible between visits.
We’ll help you understand how tobacco affects your oral health and support you in quitting, if needed
We’ll make a custom-fit mouthguard to protect your teeth during sports or while you sleep

Item Name: Fissure and/or tooth surface Sealing - Per Tooth
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll seal the grooves of your back teeth to protect them from cavities, especially helpful for kids or cavity-prone patients
We’ll apply a special treatment to help reduce sensitivity and make eating or drinking more comfortable.
We’ll gently reshape a tooth to improve its look or help with your bite.

Item Name: Treatment of Acute Periodontal Infection - per appointment
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll treat gum infections quickly to relieve pain and prevent further damage to your gums or teeth.
We’ll do a detailed exam of your gums to check for signs of gum disease and plan the right care.
We’ll clean around your teeth and under your gums to remove bacteria and help your gums heal.

Item Name: Non-Surgical Treatment Of Peri-Implant Disease - per im
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll treat infected tissue around implants to prevent bone loss and support healing.
We’ll gently lift the gums for a deep clean around the roots of your teeth if gum disease is advanced.

Item Name: Active Non-Surgical Periodontal Therapy - per quadrant
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll clean deep under the gums in one section of your mouth to stop gum disease from progressing.
We’ll do regular cleanings and checks to maintain your gum health after periodontal treatment.

Item Name: Removal Of Tooth Or Part(s) Thereof
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll gently remove a tooth that can’t be saved or is causing problems like pain or crowding.

Item Name: Sectional Removal of a Tooth or part(s) thereof
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll section the tooth to remove it in parts when a simple extraction isn’t enough.

Item Name: Surgical removal of a tooth or fragment not requiring rem
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll surgically remove a tooth that hasn’t come through properly, usually done gently and with care.

Item Name: Surgical removal of a tooth or fragment requiring both re
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll remove a problem tooth that requires both cutting and lifting techniques for safe removal.
A surgery to reshape the bone in your jaw, usually to help prepare for dentures or implants.
We’ll carefully remove a foreign object (like a splinter or piece of metal) from your gums or mouth.
We’ll treat a fluid-filled swelling by opening and draining it to relieve pressure and prevent infection.

Item Name: Surgical Exposure Of Unerupted Tooth - per tooth
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll gently uncover a tooth that hasn’t come through the gum properly so it can erupt naturally or be moved with braces.

Item Name: Repositioning of displaced tooth/teeth - per tooth
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll carefully reposition a tooth that’s been pushed out of place due to injury to help it heal correctly.

Item Name: Splinting of displaced tooth/teeth - per tooth
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll apply a splint to stabilize a loose or injured tooth so it stays in position while healing.
We’ll remove or reshape the small fold of tissue (frenum) under your tongue or lip to improve comfort or function.
We’ll drain an infection or abscess to relieve pain and allow healing.
We’ll place a protective dressing over a small exposure in the tooth pulp to help it heal and avoid root canal treatment.
We’ll remove the top portion of the tooth’s nerve and place a medication to preserve the rest, often used in baby teeth.

Item Name: Complete chemo-mechanical preparation of root canal -
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll clean and shape the root canal system of a tooth to prepare it for filling, usually due to infection or damage.

Item Name: Complete chemo-mechanical preparation of root canal -
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll do a full cleaning of the root canals in a tooth with multiple roots, preparing it for sealing.
We’ll seal the root canal of a tooth that had a single canal, completing the root canal treatment.

Item Name: Root Canal Obturation  - each additional canal
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll fill and seal any additional root canals in the same tooth as part of a complete root canal procedure.

Item Name: Extirpation of pulp or debridement of root canal(s) - emer
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll remove infected or dead tissue from inside the tooth to relieve pain and stop infection.

Item Name: Removal Of Root Filling - per canal
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll remove an old root canal filling if re-treatment is needed due to persistent infection or failure.

Item Name: Removal of a cemented root canal post or post crown
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll take out a post or crown that’s cemented into a tooth if replacement or retreatment is needed.

Item Name: Additional visit for irrigation and/or dressing of the root c
Patient-Friendly Description: This is a follow-up appointment to flush out and medicate the root canal before completing treatment.

Item Name: Adhesive restoration - one surface - anterior tooth - direc
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll repair a small part of a front tooth using tooth-coloured material to restore function and appearance.

Item Name: Adhesive restoration - two surfaces - anterior tooth - dire
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll restore two surfaces of a front tooth using tooth-coloured filling material for natural results.

Item Name: Adhesive restoration - three surfaces - anterior tooth - dir
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll rebuild three surfaces of a front tooth with composite resin to restore structure and appearance.

Item Name: Adhesive restoration - four surfaces - anterior tooth - dire
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll restore four surfaces of a front tooth, typically when a larger area has been damaged or decayed.

Item Name: Adhesive restoration - five surfaces - anterior tooth - dire
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll repair almost the entire surface of a front tooth using high-quality tooth-coloured material.

Item Name: Adhesive restoration - veneer - anterior tooth - direct
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll apply a thin layer of composite on the front of a tooth to improve its colour, shape, or size.

Item Name: Adhesive restoration - one surface - posterior tooth - dire
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll fix a back tooth with a small composite filling that blends in with your natural teeth.

Item Name: Adhesive restoration - two surfaces - posterior tooth - dir
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll restore two sides of a back tooth, usually to repair damage from decay or wear.

Item Name: Adhesive restoration - three surfaces - posterior tooth - d
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll rebuild three surfaces of a back tooth for both strength and a natural look.

Item Name: Adhesive restoration - four surfaces - posterior tooth - dir
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll restore four surfaces of a molar or premolar tooth for large cavities or breaks.

Item Name: Adhesive restoration - five surfaces - posterior tooth - dir
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll repair nearly the entire chewing surface of a back tooth using durable tooth-coloured material.

Item Name: Adhesive restoration - veneer - posterior tooth - direct
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll apply a veneer on the back tooth using composite resin to improve function or aesthetics.
We’ll place a custom-made indirect filling on one surface for added strength and longevity.
We’ll restore two surfaces of a tooth using a lab-made filling for improved durability.
We’ll rebuild three surfaces of a tooth using a high-strength indirect restoration.
We’ll repair most of a tooth with a custom-made piece that’s cemented into place.
We’ll restore nearly the full surface of a tooth with a long-lasting, aesthetic filling.
We’ll place a custom-made porcelain or composite veneer over your tooth to enhance its appearance.
We’ll place a temporary filling to protect the tooth until a permanent restoration is completed.
We’ll use a metal band to help shape and support a tooth during restoration or filling.
We’ll place a small metal pin to help secure the filling material inside a heavily damaged tooth.
We’ll cover the tooth’s cusp with filling material to strengthen it and restore function.

Item Name: Restoration of an incisal corner - per corner
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll restore a chipped or broken corner of a front tooth so it looks natural again.
We’ll bond a broken piece of your tooth back in place using special dental adhesive.

Item Name: Crown - Metallic - With Tooth Preparation  - Preformed
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll place a pre-formed metal crown to protect and restore a damaged tooth.

Item Name: Crown - Metallic - Minimal Tooth Preparation  - Preforme
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll fit a thin metal crown over the tooth with minimal preparation needed.
We’ll place a pre-formed tooth-coloured crown to restore both function and appearance.
We’ll remove a crown, bridge, or other restoration that needs replacement or adjustment.
We’ll re-cement a crown or bridge that has come loose to keep it secure.
We’ll place a support post directly into the root of a tooth to help hold a restoration in place.
We’ll create a full acrylic crown in the lab and cement it to your tooth for protection and aesthetics.
We’ll fit a full crown made from ceramic or other non-metal material for a natural look.
We’ll use a crown with a layered ceramic coating for a more aesthetic finish.
We’ll place a metal crown to restore strength and durability, often for back teeth.

Item Name: Post and core for crown - indirect
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll build a post and core inside your tooth to support a crown securely.
We’ll place a post and cap over the root of a tooth to stabilize it and support a crown.
We’ll use a post and cap system to strengthen a damaged tooth for further restoration.
We’ll place a temporary crown to protect your tooth until the final crown is ready.
We’ll make a temporary bridge tooth to fill a gap while your permanent one is made.
We’ll place a temporary abutment on your implant while the final restoration is being prepared.

Item Name: Provisional implant restoration - per implant abutment
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll attach a temporary crown to your implant so you can function and smile comfortably.
We’ll add a bridge tooth (pontic) to fill a gap, supported by crowns on nearby teeth.
We’ll use a semi-fixed attachment to link parts of your dental restoration securely.
We’ll re-cement a loose crown or veneer so it stays in place properly.

Item Name: Fitting of implant abutment - per abutment
Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll place the abutment — the piece that connects your implant to the final tooth.

Item Name: Prosthesis with resin base attached to implants - remova

Item Name: Prosthesis with metal frame attached to implants - fixed -

Item Name: Full crown attached to osseointegrated implant - veneere

We’ll add a resting component to support your denture and improve comfort.
We’ll add or adjust teeth on your partial denture to improve its function.
We’ll place a temporary tooth immediately after extraction so your smile stays intact.
We’ll add a soft lining to your denture for extra comfort, especially if gums are sore.
We’ll adjust your denture to improve its fit and relieve any pressure points.

Patient-Friendly Description: We’ll add a replacement tooth to your partial denture after an extraction.
We’ll take an impression to repair or adjust your denture accurately.

We’ll provide emergency care to relieve pain or discomfort until full treatment is done.
We’ll attend to urgent dental care needs outside normal clinic hours.
We’ll travel to your location to provide dental treatment if needed.
We’ll create a custom tray to apply special medication directly where it’s needed.
We’ll numb the treatment area to make sure you’re comfortable during the procedure.
